column4: I tried to stop a process using 'pkill -STOP [pid] '.  Its' window froze, so I killed it from the desktop.  The window disappeared, but the process is still running.  Kill and sudo kill have no affect.  How can I stop it?
The second one did the trick.  Thanks.
cool. btw, -KILL is the same as -9
TERM says, please stop. KILL says, ok, we're not going to execute any of this process's code on the CPU
